Package net.danielgill.ros.timetable.service

Class Service

java.lang.Object
net.danielgill.ros.timetable.service.Service
public class Service extends Object
Represents a single service within a timetable.
Author:
Daniel Gill

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Service​(Reference ref, String description)
    Creates a service from a reference and description.
    Service​(Reference ref, String description, int startSpeed, int maxSpeed, int mass, int maxBrake, int power)
    Creates a service from a reference, description and the service data.
    Service​(Reference ref, String description, Data data)
    Creates a service from a reference, description and the service data.
    Service​(Reference ref, String description, Data data, int startSpeed)
    Creates a service from a reference, description, the service data and start speed.

  • Constructor Details

    • Service

      public Service​(Reference ref, String description, int startSpeed, int maxSpeed, int mass, int maxBrake, int power)
      Creates a service from a reference, description and the service data.
      Parameters:
      ref - The reference for a given service.
      description - The description for a given service.
      startSpeed - The service's start speed.
      maxSpeed - The service's max speed.
      mass - The service's mass.
      maxBrake - The service's max braking force.
      power - The service's power.

    • Service

      public Service​(Reference ref, String description, Data data)
      Creates a service from a reference, description and the service data.
      Parameters:
      ref - The reference for a given service.
      description - The description for a given service.
      data - The service data.

    • Service

      public Service​(Reference ref, String description, Data data, int startSpeed)
      Creates a service from a reference, description, the service data and start speed.
      Parameters:
      ref - The reference for a given service.
      description - The description for a given service.
      data - The service data.
      startSpeed - The start speed of the service.

    • Service

      public Service​(Reference ref, String description)
      Creates a service from a reference and description.
      Parameters:
      ref - The reference for a given service.
      description - The description for a given service.

  • Method Details

    • setDetails

      @Deprecated(since="v1.2.0-alpha") public void setDetails​(Reference ref, String description)
      Deprecated.
      This method should not be used, create a new instance of Service instead.
      Sets the reference and description for a given service and creates new ArrayList.

    • setData

      public void setData​(int startSpeed, int maxSpeed, int mass, int maxBrake, int power)
      Sets the data for a given service.
      Parameters:
      startSpeed - The service's start speed.
      maxSpeed - The service's max speed.
      mass - The service's mass.
      maxBrake - The service's max braking force.
      power - The service's power.

    • setData

      public void setData​(Data data)
      Sets the data for a given service.
      Parameters:
      data - The new data for a given service.

    • addDataTemplate

      public void addDataTemplate​(DataTemplate dt, int startSpeed)
      Adds a data template and starting speed to a service.
      Parameters:
      dt - The data template to be added.
      startSpeed - The start speed of the service.

    • addEvent

      public void addEvent​(Event event)
      Adds an event at the end of the current list of events.
      Parameters:
      event - The event object to be added.
      See Also:
      Event

    • addTemplate

      public void addTemplate​(Template template, Time startTime)
      Adds a template's events to the service events, with times determined by the start time.
      Parameters:
      template - The template object to be added to the events.
      startTime - The time which will be added to the instance of the template.
      See Also:
      Template, TimedEvent

    • addTemplate

      public void addTemplate​(Template template, Time startTime, int increment)
      Adds a template's events to the service events, with times and references determined by start time and increment.
      Parameters:
      template - The template object to be added to the events.
      startTime - The time which will be added to the instance of the template.
      increment - The increment which will be added to the instance of all ReferenceEvents.
      See Also:
      Template, TimedEvent, ReferenceEvent

    • toTimetableString

      public String toTimetableString() throws ServiceInvalidException
      Provides a string output of the service for a .ttb file format.
      Returns:
      A String containing the service ready to be inserted into a .ttb file.
      Throws:
      ServiceInvalidException - Throws this if the service is invalid, should be caught and not added to a .ttb file.

    • toFormattedString

      public String toFormattedString() throws ServiceInvalidException
      Provides a string output of the service in a readable format.
      Returns:
      A string containing the service in a readable format.
      Throws:
      ServiceInvalidException - Throws this if the service is invalid, should be caught.

    • validateService

      public void validateService() throws ServiceInvalidException
      Validates the service, and throws a ServiceInvalidException if it is invalid.
      Throws:
      ServiceInvalidException - Throws this if the service is invalid.

    • getRef

      public Reference getRef()
      Returns a reference for the service.
      Returns:
      The reference for the service.

    • getDescription

      public String getDescription()
      Returns the service description.
      Returns:
      The description for the service.

    • getEventFromIndex

      public Event getEventFromIndex​(int index)
      Returns an Event from the service's event array list from a given index.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the event array list.
      Returns:
      The event located in the service's list of events.
